Module opentdk.api
Package org.opentdk.api.dispatcher

Class BaseDispatchComponent

java.lang.Object
org.opentdk.api.dispatcher.BaseDispatchComponent
public class BaseDispatchComponent
extends Object
Similar to the native enum type of java, the BaseDispatchComponent class is used to build a set of variables with the difference that their values are not static and extended access to the variables values and their attributes will be provided.
Each BaseDispatchComponent instance will be declared within a dispatcher definition class like EBaseSettings and the instance is associated with a node or field, depending on the format of the underlying DataContainer (tree or table format).

Main features of BaseDispatchComponent:
- Values and attributes of defined nodes or fields can be read from and written to the structure of the underlying DataContainer.
- In case the defined file file does not exist, it will be created once a setter method is called.
- In case that no file is associated with the dispatcher component, their values will be stored in runtime objects (DOM Document, Hashmap, Arraylist etc.) depending on the container format.
- Default values can be assigned to nodes or fields. They will be returned in case that the node or field does not exist in the runtime objects or associated files.
XML sample: 
        Declaration of a set of variables in class EBaseSettings.java:
        public static final BaseDispatchComponent APP_AUTO_POSITION = new BaseDispatchComponent(EBaseSettings.class.getSimpleName(), "AutoPosition", "/AppSettings", "true");
        public static final BaseDispatchComponent APP_LANGUAGE = new BaseDispatchComponent(EBaseSettings.class.getSimpleName(), "Language", "/AppSettings", "en");
        public static final BaseDispatchComponent APP_LOGFILE = new BaseDispatchComponent(EBaseSettings.class.getSimpleName(), "Logfile", "/AppSettings", "./logs/Application.log");
        
 
        Assign XML file to the EBaseAppSettings class within the main class of the application where the settings are used:
        EBaseAppSettings.setDataContainer(EBaseSettings.class, "./conf/AppSettings.xml");
 
        Read a value from the settings by using getter method of the BaseDispatchComponent instance:
        System.out.println(EBaseSettings.APP_LANGUAGE.getValue());
        => if the tag <Language> exist in the XML file, than the value of the tag will be returned (fr)
        => if the tag <Language> does not exist in the XML file, the default defined in the declaration will be returned (en)
 
        (Over)Write the value of a tag into the associated XML file:
        EBaseSettings.APP_LANGUAGE.setValue("de");
 
        Sample content of an associated XML file:
        <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
        <AppSettings>
        <Language>fr</Language>
        <Logfile>./logs/mp.log</Logfile>
        </AppSettings>
Author:
LK Test Solutions

    This method returns the attribute value of the of the first matching node that is associated with this BaseDispatchComponent instance.

    This method returns the attribute value of the first matching node that is associated with this BaseDispatchComponent instance and where the nodes within the hierarchical path include the attribute values that are defined by the params argument.

    This method returns the attribute values of all associated nodes of this BaseDispatchComponent instance.

    Returns the DataContainer that acts as runtime storage for the values linked to the BaseDispatchComponent instances.

    Retrieves the fieldsMap which includes the names of all BaseDispatchComponent variables, used by the application at runtime.

    Creates a DataContainer instance from an InputStream and adds the instance to the dcMap HashMap of BaseDispatchComponent.

    Creates a DataContainer instance from a given file and adds the instance to the dcMap HashMap of BaseDispatchComponent.

    Adds an DataContainer instance to the dcMap HashMap of BaseDispatchComponent.
    static void setFields​(String setKey, List<Field> fields)
    This method is called within the BaseDispatcher.setDataContainer(java.lang.Class<?>, java.lang.String) methods to assign a list with all declared BaseDispatchComponent variables, declared within a dispatcher class.
    void setValue​(String value)
    This method searches within the associated document for the first tree node or field, that matches the name and path (for tree formats) of this BaseDispatchComponent instance and assigns the value to this node/field.
    void setValue​(String params, String value)
    This method searches within the associated document for the first node that matches the name and path of this BaseDispatchComponent and assigns the value to this field.
    void setValue​(String params, String oldValue, String newValue)
    This method searches within the associated document for the first node that matches the node name, path and the defined value (oldValue argument) of this BaseDispatchComponent and replaces the value of this node by newValue.
    void setValues​(String oldValue, String newValue, boolean allOccurences)
    This method will replace the values of all nodes or fields within the associated document that match with the name and path (for tree formats) of this BaseDispatchComponent and where the current value is equal to the value defined by oldValue argument.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseDispatchComponent

      public BaseDispatchComponent()
      The default constructor if this class that is called when creating a new instance without attributes.

    • BaseDispatchComponent

      public BaseDispatchComponent​(String Key, String paramName, String dVal)
      Constructor used to declare variables for tabular formats like .properties or .csv Files
      Parameters:
      Key - - Name of the dispatcher class where the BaseDispatchComponent variable is declared. If the class is an extended subclass, then the name of the superclass needs to be used.
      paramName - - Header name of the field. Tabular formats can either have column header or row headers.
      dVal - - Default value returned by the variable in case the field doesn't exist in the associated DataContainer or file.

    • BaseDispatchComponent

      public BaseDispatchComponent​(Class<?> parentClass, String paramName, String dVal)
      Constructor used for tabular formats like .properties or .csv Files
      Parameters:
      parentClass - - The dispatcher class where the BaseDispatchComponent variable is declared. If the class is an extended subclass, then the superclass needs to be used.
      paramName - - Header name of the field. Tabular formats can either have column header or row headers.
      dVal - - Default value returned by the variable in cases the field doesn't exist in the associated DataContainer or file.

    • BaseDispatchComponent

      public BaseDispatchComponent​(Class<?> parentClass, String paramName, String pxp, String dVal)
      This constructor is used to declare variables for tree formats like XML, JSON or YAML.
      Parameters:
      parentClass - - The dispatcher class where the BaseDispatchComponent variable is declared. If the class is an extended subclass, then the superclass needs to be used.
      paramName - - Name of a node, associated with the variable
      pxp - - Path, where the tag is located within a tree structure
      dVal - - Default value returned by the variable in case the node doesn't exist in the associated DataContainer or file

    • BaseDispatchComponent

      public BaseDispatchComponent​(String setKey, String paramName, String pxp, String dVal)
      This constructor is used to declare variables for tree formats like XML, JSON or YAML.
      Parameters:
      setKey - - Name of the dispatcher class where the BaseDispatchComponent variable is declared. If the class is an extended subclass, then the name of the superclass needs to be used.
      paramName - - Name of a node, associated with the variable
      pxp - - Path, where the tag is located within a tree structure
      dVal - - Default value returned by the variable in cases the node doesn't exist in the associated DataContainer or file

  • Method Details

    • addValue

      public void addValue​(String value)
      This method adds a node or field with the defined value into the DataContainer and file that is associated with the BaseDispatchComponent variable.

       Sample BaseDispatchComponent declaration for XML format:
 public static final BaseDispatchComponent PERMITTED_USER = new BaseDispatchComponent(EAppSettings.class, "UserName", "/AppSettings/PermittedUsers", "")
 Method call:
 EAppSettings.PERMOTTED_USER.addValue("admin");
 Resulting entry within XML file:
 <AppSettings>
        <PermittedUsers>
                <UserName>admin</UserName>
        </PermittedUsers>
 </AppSettings>
      Parameters:
      value - - The value which will be set to the node or field

    • addValue

      public void addValue​(String params, String value)
      This method adds a node or field with the defined value into the DataContainer and file that is associated with the BaseDispatchComponent variable. 

       Sample BaseDispatchComponent declaration for XML format:
 public static final BaseDispatchComponent DATASET = new BaseDispatchComponent(EDataMapping.class, "set", "/Mappings/mapping[@name='{param_1}']", "")
 Method call:
 EDataMapping.DATASET.addValue("CountryCode", "France;FR");
 Resulting entry within XML file:
 <Mappings>
        <mapping name="CountryCode">
                <set>Germany;D</UserName>
                <set>France;FR</UserName>
        </mapping>
 </Mappings>
      Parameters:
      params - - Semicolon separated string with attribute values of the parent nodes that describe the path more uniquely.
      value - - The value which will be set to the node or field

    • addValue

      public void addValue​(String value, boolean noDuplicates)
      This method adds a node or field with the defined value into the DataContainer and file that is associated with the BaseDispatchComponent variable.

       Sample BaseDispatchComponent declaration for XML format:
 public static final BaseDispatchComponent PERMITTED_USER = new BaseDispatchComponent(EAppSettings.class, "UserName", "/AppSettings/PermittedUsers", "")
 Method call:
 EAppSettings.PERMOTTED_USER.addValue("admin");
 Resulting entry within XML file:
 <AppSettings>
        <PermittedUsers>
                <UserName>admin</UserName>
        </PermittedUsers>
 </AppSettings>
      Parameters:
      value - - The value which will be set to the node or field
      noDuplicates - - true = do not create duplicate nodes or fields; false = create duplicate nodes or fields

    • addValue

      public void addValue​(String params, String value, boolean noDuplicates)
      This method adds a node or tag with the defined value into the DataContainer and file that is associated with the BaseDispatchComponent variable.

       Sample BaseDispatchComponent declaration for XML format:
 public static final BaseDispatchComponent DATASET = new BaseDispatchComponent(EDataMapping.class, "set", "/Mappings/mapping[@name='{param_1}']", "")
 Method call:
 EDataMapping.DATASET.addValue("CountryCode", "France;FR");
 Resulting entry within XML file:
 <Mappings>
        <mapping name="CountryCode">
                <set>Germany;D</UserName>
                <set>France;FR</UserName>
        </mapping>
 </Mappings>
      Parameters:
      params - - Semicolon separated string with attribute values of the parent nodes that describe the path more uniquely.
      value - - The value which will be set to the new node
      noDuplicates - - true = do not create duplicate nodes; false = create duplicate nodes

    • checkDispatcherFile

      public static boolean checkDispatcherFile​(String fileName, String rootNode)
      Checks if the assigned file matches with the expected format of the BaseDispatchComponent.
      Parameters:
      fileName - - Full name of the file to check.
      rootNode - - The value of this parameter defines the expected name of the root node within tree formated file.
      Returns:
      true = rootNode matches with the first node within the file ; false = rootNode does not match to the first node within the file

    • checkDispatcherFile

      public static boolean checkDispatcherFile​(DataContainer dc, String rootNode)
      Checks if the file, associated with the DataContainer dc, matches with the expected format of the BaseDispatchComponent.
      Parameters:
      dc - - DataContainer instance with the associated file, that needs to be checked
      rootNode - - The value of this parameter defines the expected name of the root node within tree formated file.
      Returns:
      true = rootNode matches with the first node within the file ; false = rootNode does not match to the first node within the file

    • checkDispatcherFile

      public static boolean checkDispatcherFile​(String fileName, String rootNode, boolean createNew)
      Checks if the file, associated with the DataContainer dc, matches with the expected format of the BaseDispatchComponent.
      Parameters:
      fileName - - Full name of the file to check.
      rootNode - - The value of this parameter defines the expected name of the root node within tree formated file.
      createNew - - defines the behavior if the file does not exist.
      true = create new file with first node and return true
      false = do nothing and return false
      Returns:
      true = rootNode matches with the first node within the file ; false = rootNode does not match to the first node within the file

    • clearDataContainer

      public static void clearDataContainer()
      Removes all the mappings from the DataContainer HashMap.
      See Also:
      Map.clear()

    • delete

      public void delete()
      Deletes all nodes or fields within the associated DataContainer and file that are representing entries for this BaseDispatchComponent.

      XML Sample
      The method call: 
              EBaseAppSettings.APP_TRACE_LEVEL.delete();
      performed on the following BaseDispatchComponent variable, defined within the settings class EBaseAppSettings: 
              public static final BaseDispatchComponent APP_TRACE_LEVEL = new BaseDispatchComponent(EBaseAppSettings.class, "TraceLevel", "/AppSettings", "1");
      will delete the tag TraceLevel of the following XML sample: 
              <AppSettings>
                <TraceLevel>1</TraveLevel>
        </AppSettings>
      If multiple tags with the same name and XPath exist, then all matching tags will be deleted.

    • delete

      public void delete​(String attrName, String attrValue)
      Deletes all matching nodes or fields with an assigned attribute within the associated DataContainer and file that are representing entries for this BaseDispatchComponent.

      XML Sample
      The method call: 
              EBaseAppSettings.APP_TRACE_LEVEL.delete("name", "Security");
      performed on the following BaseDispatchComponent variable, defined within the settings class EBaseAppSettings: 
              public static final BaseDispatchComponent APP_TRACE_LEVEL = new BaseDispatchComponent(EBaseAppSettings.class, "TraceLevel", "/AppSettings", "1");
      will delete the tag TraceLevel of the following XML sample: 
              <AppSettings>
                <TraceLevel name="Security">1</TraveLevel>
        </AppSettings>
      If multiple tags with the same name and XPath exist, then all matching tags will be deleted.
      Parameters:
      attrName - - Attribute name of the node or field that will be deleted
      attrValue - - Attribute value of the node or field that will be deleted

    • delete

      public void delete​(String params, String attrName, String attrValue)
      Deletes all matching nodes or fields with an assigned attribute within the associated DataContainer and file that are representing entries for this BaseDispatchComponent. In addition the nodes within the path hierarchy can be identified by an attribute

      XML Sample
      The method call: 
              ECollectionRules.QUERY_FILTERVALUE.delete("Search LK Test;COMPANY_NAME", "", "");
      performed on the following BaseDispatchComponent variable, defined within the settings class ECollectionRules: 
              public static final BaseDispatchComponent QUERY_FILTERVALUE = new BaseDispatchComponent(ECollectionRules.class.getSimpleName(), "value", "/Rules/rule[@name='{param_1}']/Query/filter[@column='{param_2}']", "");
      will delete the tag value with the value LK Test Solutions GmbH of the following XML sample: 
              <Rules>
                <rule name="Search LK Test">
                <Query>
                                <filter column="COMPANY_NAME">
                                        <value>LK Test Solutions GmbH</value>
                                </filter>
                                <filter column="CITY">
                                        <value>Munich</value>
                                </filter>
                        </Query>
                </rule>
        </Rules>
      If multiple tags with the same name and XPath exist, then all matching tags will be deleted.
      Parameters:
      params - - Semicolon separated string with attribute values of parent nodes within the path hierarchy.
      attrName - - Attribute name of the node or field that will be deleted
      attrValue - - Attribute value of the node or field that will be deleted

    • getAttribute

      public String getAttribute​(String attrName)
      This method returns the attribute value of the of the first matching node that is associated with this BaseDispatchComponent instance. 
       XML Sample:
 EAppSettings.POS.getAttribute("axis");
 executed on the following XML content:
 <AppSettings><Geometry><Pos axis="X">50</Pos></Geometry></AppSettings>
 returns the value "X"
      Parameters:
      attrName - - the name of the nodes attribute to search for
      Returns:
      the value of the defined attribute

    • getAttribute

      public String getAttribute​(String params, String attrName)
      This method returns the attribute value of the first matching node that is associated with this BaseDispatchComponent instance and where the nodes within the hierarchical path include the attribute values that are defined by the params argument. 
       XML sample:f
 EAppSettings.POS.getAttributes("Settings", "axis");
 executed on the following XML content:
 <AppSettings><Geometry window="Help"><Pos axis="X">80</Pos></Geometry></AppSettings>
 <AppSettings><Geometry window="Help"><Pos axis="Y">120</Pos></Geometry></AppSettings>
 <AppSettings><Geometry window="Settings"><Pos axis="X1">100</Pos></Geometry></AppSettings>
 <AppSettings><Geometry window="Settings"><Pos axis="Y1">150</Pos></Geometry></AppSettings>
 returns the value "X1"
      Parameters:
      params - - a semicolon separated string with attribute values within the path
      attrName - - the name of the node attribute to search for
      Returns:
      the value of the matching attribute

    • getAttributes

      public String[] getAttributes​(String attrName)
      This method returns the attribute values of all associated nodes of this BaseDispatchComponent instance. 
       XML sample:
 EAppSettings.POS.getAttributes("axis");
 executed on the following XML content:
 <AppSettings><Geometry><Pos axis="X">50</Pos></Geometry></AppSettings>
 <AppSettings><Geometry><Pos axis="Y">100</Pos></Geometry></AppSettings>
 returns the values ["X", "Y"]
      Parameters:
      attrName - - the name of the nodes attribute to search for
      Returns:
      the values of all matching attributes as array of type String

    • getAttributes

      public String[] getAttributes​(String params, String attrName)
      This method returns the attribute values of all matching nodes that are associated with this BaseDispatchComponent instance and where the nodes within the hierarchical path include the attribute values that are defined by the params argument. 
       XML sample:
 EAppSettings.POS.getAttributes("Settings", "axis");
 executed on the following XML content:
 <AppSettings><Geometry window="Help"><Pos axis="X">80</Pos></Geometry></AppSettings>
 <AppSettings><Geometry window="Help"><Pos axis="Y">120</Pos></Geometry></AppSettings>
 <AppSettings><Geometry window="Settings"><Pos axis="X1">100</Pos></Geometry></AppSettings>
 <AppSettings><Geometry window="Settings"><Pos axis="Y1">150</Pos></Geometry></AppSettings>
 returns the values ["X1", "Y1"]
      Parameters:
      params - - a semicolon separated string with attribute values within the path
      attrName - - the name of the nodes attribute to search for
      Returns:
      the values of all matching attribute as array of type String

    • getDataContainer

      public static DataContainer getDataContainer​(String keyName)
      Returns the DataContainer that acts as runtime storage for the values linked to the BaseDispatchComponent instances.
      Parameters:
      keyName - - Name of the key where the DataContainer is stored within the HashMap. This should be the simple name of the dispatcher class. If the dispatcher class is an extended class, then the simple name of its superclass needs to be defined.
      Returns:
      The DataContainer object, representing the runtime storage for the dispatcher

    • getFieldsMap

      public static Map<String,​List<Field>> getFieldsMap()
      Retrieves the fieldsMap which includes the names of all BaseDispatchComponent variables, used by the application at runtime.
      Returns:
      fielsMap property of type HashMap

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the parameterName property of the BaseDispatchComponent.
      Returns:
      The value of the parameterName property as string
      See Also:
      parameterName

    • getValue

      public String getValue()
      This method retrieves the value that is assigned to the BaseDispatchComponent variable in the following way:
      - Search the node or field, defined by property parameterName. For tree formats the node will be searched within the XPath, defined by property parentXPath
      - If the node or field does not exist within the associated DataContainer, the default value defined by property defaultValue will be retrieved.
      - If multiple nodes or fields exist, then the first value will be retrieved
      Returns:
      the value, assigned to the BaseDispatchComponent variable as String

    • getValue

      public String getValue​(String params)
      This method retrieves the value that is assigned to the BaseDispatchComponent variable in the following way:
      - Search the node or field, defined by property parameterName. For tree formats the node will be searched within the XPath, defined by property parentXPath
      - If the node or field does not exist within the associated DataContainer, the default value defined by property defaultValue will be retrieved.
      - If multiple nodes or fields exist, then the first value will be retrieved
      Parameters:
      params - - Semicolon separated string with the values of node attributes within the parentXPath
      Returns:
      the value, assigned to the BaseDispatchComponent variable as String

    • getValues

      public String[] getValues()
      This method retrieves the values that are assigned to the BaseDispatchComponent variable in the following way:
      - Search the nodes or fields, defined by property parameterName. For tree formats the nodes will be searched within the XPath, defined by property parentXPath
      - If the nodes or fields do not exist within the associated DataContainer, the default value defined by property defaultValue will be retrieved.
      - Otherwise the values of all matching nodes or fields will be retrieved.
      Returns:
      the values, assigned to the BaseDispatchComponent variable as Array of type String

    • getValues

      public String[] getValues​(String params)
      This method retrieves the values that are assigned to the BaseDispatchComponent variable in the following way:
      - Search the nodes or fields, defined by property parameterName. For tree formats the nodes will be searched within the XPath, defined by property parentXPath
      - If the nodes or fields do not exist within the associated DataContainer, the default value defined by property defaultValue will be retrieved.
      - Otherwise the values of all matching nodes will be retrieved
      Parameters:
      params - - Semicolon separated string with the values of tag attributes within the parentXPath
      Returns:
      the values, assigned to the BaseDispatchComponent variable as Array of type String

    • setAttribute

      public void setAttribute​(String attrName, String attrValue)
      Sets the attribute of a node. The method overwrites identical node with this attribute, in case the existing attributes value is empty. In any other case the tag will be added to the parendXPath.
      Parameters:
      attrName - - Attribute name of the node
      attrValue - - Attribute value of the node that will be set

    • setAttribute

      public void setAttribute​(String params, String attrName, String attrValue)
      Sets the attribute of a node. The method overwrites identical node with this attribute, in case the existing attributes value is empty. In any other case the node will be added to the parendXPath.
      Parameters:
      params - - Semicolon separated string with attribute values of parent tags within the XPath hierarchy.
      attrName - - Attribute name of the node
      attrValue - - Attribute value of the node that will be set

    • setAttribute

      public void setAttribute​(String oldValue, String params, String attrName, String attrValue)
      Sets the attribute of a node. The method overwrites identical node with this attribute, in case the existing attributes value is empty. In any other case the node will be added to the parendXPath.
      Parameters:
      oldValue - Attribute value of the node that will be searched and overwritten
      params - Semicolon separated string with attribute values of parent nodes within the XPath hierarchy.
      attrName - Attribute name of the node
      attrValue - Attribute value of the node that will be set

    • setDataContainer

      public static void setDataContainer​(String keyName, String settingsFile)
      Creates a DataContainer instance from a given file and adds the instance to the dcMap HashMap of BaseDispatchComponent. The keyName within the HashMap should be the simple name of the dispatcher class, where the BaseDispatchComponent variables are declared. In case the dispatcher class is a subclass of a superclass with predefined BaseDispatchComponent variables like EBaseSettings, then the simple name of the superclass needs to be used.

       Sample usage:
        ECollectorSettings.setDataContainer(ECollectorSettings.class, "c:\\Appdata\\MetricsCollector\\conf\\msettings.xml");
      Parameters:
      keyName - - Name of the key where the DataContainer is stored within the HashMap. This should be the simplename of the settings class.
      settingsFile - - Full name of the XML file that will be associated with the settings class where the BaseDispatchComponent variable is declared.

    • setDataContainer

      public static void setDataContainer​(String setKey, DataContainer dc)
      Adds an DataContainer instance to the dcMap HashMap of BaseDispatchComponent. The keyName within the HashMap should be the simple name of the dispatcher class, where the BaseDispatchComponent variables are declared. In case the dispatcher class is a subclass of a superclass with predefined BaseDispatchComponent variables like EBaseSettings, then the simple name of the superclass needs to be used.

       Sample usage:
        DataContainer dc = new DataContainer("c:\\Appdata\\MetricsCollector\\conf\\msettings.xml");
        ECollectorSettings.setDataContainer(ECollectorSettings.class, dc);
      Parameters:
      setKey - - Name of the key where the DataContainer is stored within the HashMap. This should be the simple name of the settings class.
      dc - - A DataContainer instance which is associated to a file in a format, described by the dispatcher class.

    • setDataContainer

      public static void setDataContainer​(String keyName, InputStream inStream)
      Creates a DataContainer instance from an InputStream and adds the instance to the dcMap HashMap of BaseDispatchComponent. The keyName within the HashMap should be the simple name of the dispatcher class, where the BaseDispatchComponent variables are declared. In case the dispatcher class is a subclass of a superclass with predefined BaseDispatchComponent variables like EBaseSettings, then the simple name of the superclass needs to be used.

       XML sample:
 String xmlContent = "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\" standalone=\"yes\"?><rootTag>...</rootTag>"
 InputStream stream = new ByteArrayInputStream(xmlContent.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8));
 ECollectorSettings.setDataContainer(ECollectorSettings.class, stream);
      Parameters:
      keyName - - Name of the key where the DataContainer is stored within the HashMap.
      inStream - - A InputStream with content in a format of any supported DataContainer
      See Also:
      DataContainer(InputStream)

    • setFields

      public static void setFields​(String setKey, List<Field> fields)
      This method is called within the BaseDispatcher.setDataContainer(java.lang.Class<?>, java.lang.String) methods to assign a list with all declared BaseDispatchComponent variables, declared within a dispatcher class.
      Parameters:
      setKey - - The key under which the fields list will be stored within the HashMap. This should be the simple name of the dispatcher class, where the BaseDispatchComponent variables are declared.
      fields - - A List object with the names of all BaseDispatchComponent variables of a dispatcher class.

    • setValue

      public void setValue​(String value)
      This method searches within the associated document for the first tree node or field, that matches the name and path (for tree formats) of this BaseDispatchComponent instance and assigns the value to this node/field. If no node/field is found, then a new node/field will be created. If one or more nodes/fields exist, then the value of the first matching node/field will be overwritten. 
       XML Sample:
 EAppSettings.POSX.setValue("100");
 Replaces the value 50 of the following XML tag by 100:
 <AppSettings><Geometry><PosX>50</PosX></Geometry></AppSettings>
      Parameters:
      value - - the value that will be written into the node or field

    • setValue

      public void setValue​(String params, String value)
      This method searches within the associated document for the first node that matches the name and path of this BaseDispatchComponent and assigns the value to this field. As additional search criteria, the params argument can be used to enclose the search to path nodes with specific attribute values. If no node is found, then a new node will be created. If one or more nodes exist, then the value of the first matching node will be overwritten. 
       XML sample:
 EAppSettings.POSX.setValue("Help", "100");
 Replaces the value 50 of the following XML tag by 100:
 <AppSettings><Geometry window="Help"><PosX>50</PosX></Geometry></AppSettings>
      Parameters:
      params - - Semicolon separated string with the values of node attributes within the nodes path
      value - - the value that will be written into the node

    • setValue

      public void setValue​(String params, String oldValue, String newValue)
      This method searches within the associated document for the first node that matches the node name, path and the defined value (oldValue argument) of this BaseDispatchComponent and replaces the value of this node by newValue. As additional search criteria, the params argument can be used to enclose the search to path nodes with specific attribute values. Use an empty string for the params argument to search for all path nodes by name only. If no node is found, then a new node will be created. If one or more nodes exist, then the value of the first matching node will be overwritten. 
       XML sample:
 EAppSettings.POSX.setValue("Help", "50", "100");
 Assigns the value 100 to the PosX tag, only if the tag already exists within the XML document and only when the current value is 50.
 Replaces the value 50 of the following XML tag by 100:
 <AppSettings><Geometry window="Help"><PosX>50</PosX></Geometry></AppSettings>
      Parameters:
      params - - Semicolon separated string with the values of tag attributes within the parent path
      oldValue - - the node value that will be replaced
      newValue - - the value that will overwrite the oldValue

    • setValues

      public void setValues​(String oldValue, String newValue, boolean allOccurences)
      This method will replace the values of all nodes or fields within the associated document that match with the name and path (for tree formats) of this BaseDispatchComponent and where the current value is equal to the value defined by oldValue argument. The argument allOccurences defines if all matching node or field values will be replaced or only the first one.
      Parameters:
      oldValue - - The value of a node or field that will be searched for
      newValue - - The value that will be used to overwrite the found nodes or fields
      allOccurences - - true = overwrite all matching node or field values; false = overwrite only the first matching node or field value
